website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive, packed with sun-cured hay, apples, and sweet dried cane molasses, these rugged little biscuits provide an especially entertaining challenge for dedicated chewers.
pros: Wheat flour, timothy grass hay, soy oil, dehydrated apples, and flaxseed are the first 5 ingredients
Best for rabbits, guinea pigs, and chinchillas
cons: These dense little biscuits are extremely hard, so some small animals may prefer a softer treat

customer_reviews.title: My Wild Rabbit LOVES THEM
customer_reviews.text: Again, I have a wild rabbit who loves them so much she follows me. I was so shocked when a Wild Rabbit ate out of my hand it was crazy. She can even smell them in my robe pocket if it is early in the morning. I have only fed her 5 times now and she sees me and comes hopping to me. I will put the video up to show you how much she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Holder

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pig Won't Touch Them
customer_reviews.text: It seems from the other comments that rabbits love these things, but our guinea pig won't touch them. To try to save them from going to waste, we also tried feeding them to our friend's guinea pig who doesn't like them either. Not a huge sample size, but my guess would be that this snack is better suited for some animals than others. If you're looking for guinea pig treats, I'd try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Like crack for rabbits
customer_reviews.text: My bunny is obsessed with these. OBSESSED. Im convinced she would inject herself if she could. These biscuits are definitely something rabbits like. My baby jumps up to the bag to eat them [as you can see in the picture ] amd if you leave the bag closed on the floor she will thrash it around untill she gets the sweet necter inside which is the biscuit
customer_reviews.author: Quantum Apotheosis

customer_reviews.title: My rabbits love them. But
customer_reviews.text: My rabbits love them. But, I'm concerned about all the ingredients. Bunnies have sensitive stomachs, so I give them one each once a week at most. Honestly, unless the company is more proactive about their ingredients I won't be purchasing these again. Kaytee is kind of like Little Debbies for rabbits!
customer_reviews.author: suzizdashiz

customer_reviews.title: Cookies for bunnies
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit loves these. They are about the size of a small cookie so they are really too big to give to any smaller animal as a daily treat. That said, the rabbit looks forward to getting them and does act like a little kid getting his cookie. Also Kaytee is known for high quality products so I do not need to worry that there are any bad ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: T. BlackTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Please read
customer_reviews.text: Not the healthiest option due to the high amount of artificial ingredients (seeds, preservatives, etc.) But my piggies seem to enjoy them. I give these to them at most once a week due to the ingredients. Please be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Something Is Off With Them
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my guinea babies love apples. I give them raw apples, baked regular apples and apple flavored treats and they love them all. I gave them this and it was different. My female who is very ( for a lack of better words ) opinionated & picky completely refused. She wouldn't take it out of my hand and walked away. My male tried one out of my hand and let it drop after a few nibbles. He then walked away and stared at me. These are made a nice size and I thought they would love them but they didn't. They don't smell like apple, either.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and hamster loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My Syrian Hamster Waffles LOVES these. It’s not his favorite treat but it is up there as one of the better ones that he likes. I also bought the carrot flavored ones which he does like-but he definitely likes these better. I find them half chewed in his hide often. They are quite hard which is great for his dental health and because they have a hole in the middle I am able to hang them from a kabob to keep his interest. Sometimes I will also break one apart and give him a little chunk of one for a quick treat. These are super inexpensive compared to most hamster treats and a good amount come in one package.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Toy and Snack
customer_reviews.text: These are great snacks to toss in during the afternoon, since they're made of hay they're still healthy and they're dense enough to wear down teeth while keeping my bunny busy for a good while. He really likes them! They're natural and comprised of a diet staple so I don't have to worry about giving him something unhealthy.
customer_reviews.author: Julia KarenTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Large, Hard Biscuits
customer_reviews.text: These treats are quite large, and very hard. It is virtually impossible for me to break one apart in my hand. Our guinea pig has to chew pretty hard to break off pieces small enough to eat. I don't know if this really bothers him, maybe he likes it, but it bothers me to see him apparently struggling somewhat to break off the pieces. I wish I could ask him what his opinion is of these biscuits. But he does eat them, although he may not eat the entire biscuit.
customer_reviews.author: Bumppo

customer_reviews.title: My guinea pigs don't like them
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if any other guinea pigs like these, but neither of mine will even touch them. I will put one in their cage every now and then and it will sit in there the entire day until I take it out and throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My chinchillas liked them.
customer_reviews.text: I don't generally give treats to my chinchillas only on rare occasions. They eat hay and chinchilla pellets every so often they get a treat. Anyway, one of my chinchillas grabbed the treat and started eating until finished. The other always has to sniff things before he'll take a bite but he loved it too. Alot of people say their pet didnt like it I'm sure just like humans animals have preferences to what they like and don't like. Anyway, good for the occasional treat I give my pets. Wish I could give more treats but it isn't healthy for chinchillas to have to many.
customer_reviews.author: 100% usa

customer_reviews.title: Hay Biscuits
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I had to rate "flavor" a three, because I've never actually tasted rodent food. That being said, my chinchilla likes these. The chinchilla hates hay; it's a pellet junkie. These biscuits are a happy medium between hay and pellets. The biscuits are as tightly compressed as pellets, offering visual and texture variety.
customer_reviews.author: Penny PincherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My bun buns absolutely loves these!
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased on a whim since we had a chew toy that had apple treats and decided why not try the biscuits. Long story short, my bunny loves loves these. Since he is still small, I break the biscuit in half in which he will pick it up and eat it while holding it with both his little hands and just the cutest. Will continue to purchase as these as a great deal and in all, I absolutely love the Kaytee brand, Have never had any issues with the pellets or the hay. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: My Bunnies Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are over $4 at the pet store so buying them on amazon is a great deal. I buy multiple bags at a time because my bunnies go through them pretty fast. I give these treats credit for making my shy bunny come out of her shell. Now instead of hiding she comes to the front of her room begging for treats and pets. They also seem like they are ok for bunnies with sensitive tummies because I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Devin McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Bunnies/Hamsters favorites
customer_reviews.text: These are my rabbits absolute favorite treats. My hamster also enjoys them he just doesn’t get them as often. They last a good while and they’re so cheap! I used to buy at petsmart and have gone through several bags in the past 3 years since then I’m glad I found them here for cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Picky rabbit loved these!
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit loved these treats. He recently got a new cage and now has a bowl just for treats. These were the first treats that I decided to fill the bowl with because they are a little bit healthier then the normal fare. He loved them and I don't have to worry about him eating too much because the main ingredient is timothy hay which is good for him to eat anyway. I'm going to be trying the carrot flavor of these next and I hope he likes them as much. He is a very picky bunny so to find something he likes to eat that isn't junk has been difficult so I am very happy with these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: Great for rabbits!
customer_reviews.text: Our rabbit loves these! We call them his cookies. We can't even say the word, "cookie", unless we are going to give him one. I work out every day in our workout room and as soon as I'm done he knows it's cookie time! He will stomp his foot if he thinks I'm taking too long getting his cookie. I hope they never discontinue these!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bunny treat
customer_reviews.text: Been ordering these for a couple of years, I use them as a treat for my bun when I leave the house and need him to go into his little house. He absolutely loves them and gets more excited for one of these than anything else. I keep thinking he might get tired of them and I'll lose my easy trick to get him in his house, but the thrill has yet to fade. Not sure how healthy they are, but I only give him one to maybe two a day. He still eats his regular food just fine and he's in great health. Great treat for my boo and super cheap. I'd say we love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: DeWayne Blundell

customer_reviews.title: Guinea pigs ate one and then done
customer_reviews.text: It may just be personal piggie preference, but our guineas don’t care for these. They took the first one with excitement - “it’s new and interesting - yay!” But then never again. They look at me as if to say “again, you’re trying to feed us those?” Have tried to give them several times, based even mixing in with their food and always they end up shoved aside and making their way to the bathroom sections of the cage. I can take a hint...
customer_reviews.author: Kaysyrah

customer_reviews.title: GI troubles!!!! Dangerous!!
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to figure out what was giving both of my buns tiny, malformed poops. Took these treats away and buns are doing better, poops back to normal. My little girl was so sick, I had to take her to the vet. Found out from research that buns shouldn't eat wheat flour, or any flour. I'm not buying my rabbits anything made by Kaytee or Vitacraft again. I'm sticking to Oxbow or Meadow Loops.
customer_reviews.author: BorntoRead

customer_reviews.title: OK. My rats dont love them
customer_reviews.text: I would first like to say I have had 5 rats total and my current ones are by far the pickiest in terms of food. But, they hesitate before taking this treat from me which isn’t a sign that they are loving it. Whereas if I give then popcorn its gone before I know it! But, they did end up eating them eventually. Not sure its the right treat for my rats!
customer_reviews.author: Soph

customer_reviews.title: Pig won't touch them...he changed his mind.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my guinea pig while he was sick to entice him to eat while we were force feeding him. He's well now, but still won't touch these. I've been offering them to him for months, just because I have them. I'm not really heart broken because the ingredients seem a little iffy anyway. There seem to be a lot of additives, but they're probably fine for an occasional treat. If they eat them. Update: He's randomly started liking them. I've purchased a second bag. I guess I wore him down. Upgrade to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Our rabbits LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: We can never be without these at our house! Our bunnies love them! They get in their routine and will run to the door to get one. We have tried several treats with our buns and these are their favorite. Added bonus that they seem a lot more healthy than some other alternatives. They are such a great deal on Amazon, in the store we have paid 2-3 times more.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Bo

customer_reviews.title: Hamster hates them
customer_reviews.text: No idea what the issue is, but these smell funny (like cardboard) and the hamster cowers away from them with his eyes closed like I am trying to spray something in his face. He hates them and has never eaten one or even let me get one close to him.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon U

customer_reviews.title: Picky Hamster Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: My syrian hamster was giving me a bit of stress as he refused to chew on any of his wood blocks. His teeth were a bit long to begin with and i was concerned a vet trip would ensue, but he took to these immediately. He's sort of particular about treats, and he doesn't like to chew wood blocks (neither flavored nor unflavored interest him). But he goes nuts for these. They definitely seem hard enough that they'll wear his teeth down, and i don't have to worry about if he's using his blocks enough anymore.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Hey Mikey! Bunny loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars for flavor because my bunny grabbed it and turned around and chowed down. LOL, I think if I'd tried backsies I'd have lost a finger! Anyway, a nice treat that my bunny seems to really, really like.
customer_reviews.author: A. meyer

customer_reviews.title: A winner with all three bunnies
customer_reviews.text: I can’t personally vouch for the flavor ;) but I have three rabbits (two of whom are extremely picky eaters) and they all get so excited when I open the bag of these. My girl doesn’t like the carrot variety but she loves the apple. I’m strict with their diets but these are amazing for the occasional treat and they love them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Merchant

customer_reviews.title: Piggies and Bun Bun Love them!
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs and bunny all love these treats. They get excited when they see me with the bag. I mostly use them during out of the cage time to help with bonding, but every piggie parent knows how hard it is to resist giving them a treat when they start wheeking when you walk in the room. The price is great too! I only wish they sold them in larger bags so I didn't have to purchase them so often.
customer_reviews.author: Adrena

customer_reviews.title: Cookies for our guinea pig
customer_reviews.text: We have a guinea pig with hyperthyroidism and keeping her weight steady is rough. On a whim we tried the Kaytee biscuits in both apple and carrot flavors. The piggies like them both but have their own individual preferences. The suggested serving is 3-5 a day for a guinea pig which seems excessive, so we just end up doing 1-2 a day and they seem rather happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Mice love it!
customer_reviews.text: I actually used these as bait in a no-kill mousetrap (apparently I got the only mice in the world who don't like peanut butter, go figure!). They love this stuff! Caught and released all five mice without a hitch - apparently it's so good that even when they saw their kin getting picked up they still couldn't resist! Now I just wish I knew what to do with the rest of the bag...
customer_reviews.author: Gracie V

customer_reviews.title: Good for dogs too
customer_reviews.text: My rabbits love these. There is wheat and molasses, so they can be fattening. My dog on the other hand is on a diet and loves these instead of biscuits. Funny how the vet says don't give carrots to the rabbit since they're getting fat and then says give the dog carrots since she's getting fat. Good news is the dog has lost a ton just from these and carrots. Bad news is- the rabbits are getting fat. The vet says dump the carrots first since these are better for the rabbits. Gives them something to chew.
customer_reviews.author: 3rd grade teacher

customer_reviews.title: Good little treat
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit & guinea pigs really love them, but they don't have the best ingredients....so it'll definitely be given sparingly....At least they'll last awhile! Packaged well, all the little biscuits were intact.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My Mice and Rats Don't Really Like Them
customer_reviews.text: 3 mice and 2 rats have all decided that these are edible, but just barely. Most of the time I'm pulling out the same number I put in when it comes time to clean the cage. I can get SOME of them to nibble by softening the biscuits with water first, but who wants to have to go through that just to make them edible.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H.

customer_reviews.title: Concerned about ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: Good treat for the cost. Pig likes it but concerned about the ingredients. I was told seeds, nuts and other wheat products were bad for a guineapig. Contains small amounts of all these. Suggest only giving them one every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Valentine

customer_reviews.title: My piggies 💜💜 💜 KAYTEE Timothy Baked Apple Biscuits treats!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the KAYTEE Timothy Baked Apple Biscuits as treats for my guinea pigs & they absolutely love them! 💞 The piggies wheek!!! with delight so i will definitely be buying more of these. Shipping was super fast as usual, and my packages are always delivered with care, thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G & JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Addiction for rats
customer_reviews.text: My boys couldn't get enough of them. They were the first thing that they foraged for in the mixture of food and treats that I have created for them. They actually take their time eating them too. It is funny to watch. It is like they are savoring it and every tiny morsel.
customer_reviews.author: wendellsue66

customer_reviews.title: Whiskers Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew's hamster loves these. He just sent me a little video of her eating one. I would definitely buy more from this brand, in fact I already put the yogurt and seed treats into my shopping cart. I love that there are all kinds of fun things like these treats for hamsters these days.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Watson

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED: Guinea Pig, no. Hamster, yes.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I changed this from a 1-star to a 3-star. My guinea pig still has zero interest, but we hung onto them. Bought my daughter a hamster recently, and he LOVES them. 1-star for the pig, 5 stars for the hamster = 3 stars. My guinea pig took 2 nibbles, and never touched them again. Won’t eat it as food, treat, OR chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit-rated 5-stars
customer_reviews.text: Our rabbit goes nuts for these. She races to our feet the second we say "treat". She makes pig-grunt noises when eating these. We break them up so that it will seem that we give her more. Too much sugar is bad for our rabbit's digestion, so these are great in moderation.
customer_reviews.author: kcarr

customer_reviews.title: Nice treat to offer your little baby. Timothy hay benefits without the mess!
customer_reviews.text: These are well packaged and a great size, just not one of my boys (rats) favorites. My guys eat these don't get me wrong they just tend to stash these away and eat them last compared to the other variety of treats I offer them. There are a fairly decent amount in the bag in relation to the price.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Gipson

customer_reviews.title: I Love Buying These Treats For My Guinea Girls!
customer_reviews.text: My cavies love these timothy hay apple biscuits. I have tried other flavours but these seem to be the ones they like most. I love to feed these to them while they lay on my lap and/or chest for our ‘bonding time’...they will let me hold the biscuits for them while they chew away ❤️ I cannot believe I get these for $1.44 a bag (really good deal for as many as you get in each package).
customer_reviews.author: Joey Love

customer_reviews.title: Rabbits give these treats a "10" !
customer_reviews.text: My two rabbits LOVE these treats. They know they get them at a certain time every morning and the two bunnies go bonkers in their cage until I get to them with these treats! If I run out, heaven forbid, I have to grab something else, like a piece of apple. They are happy to get the apple, but they still sit and wait for that particular treat.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Blocker

customer_reviews.title: My bunnies love these. Fast shipping. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: My bunnies absolutely love these. I was holding one of my bunnies and decided she had enough treats so I put the package to the side, half closing it and went back to watching tv. Next thing I know my bunny is opening the bag and had her head in it sneaking treats! They love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: well this is a good seller
customer_reviews.text: i just rated low cause my piggies didn't like the taste of these things i thought they would love them for christmas gift but i was wrong so won't buy them again got search for something else they like chew treat toys maybe find newer one of those instead
customer_reviews.author: melissa rowe

customer_reviews.title: Treats are LARGE.
customer_reviews.text: I like these apple treats but they are a lot larger than I expected. About the size of a nickel or dime. Theyre easy to break or cut apart so no big deal there. As for flavor, my mice enjoy these treats and like to have them as often as I allow it! Mouse reccomended!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Richardson Small

customer_reviews.title: Guinea pigs LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: Mi Guinea pigs LOVE them! I have two guinea pigs that will eat these treats in a second. Also my friend's guinea pigs go crazy with these. They made a great Christmas present for a guinea pig owner. Also the price here is unbeatable!!! I feed these once per day to my piggies at night. And I gave the vitamin c ones in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Pulpo

customer_reviews.title: Great bun treats
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few treats I can give to my bun. He has a sensative tummy and most treats can give him runnier poops, which is not fun to scrub off. Hay based treats he does fine with and he is obsessed with these! He has never had tummy issues on them and they must smell/taste great! He is a very, very picky eater, but will do anythingggg for one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Edessa Lytle

customer_reviews.title: Will keep buying!
customer_reviews.text: I mixed these into my big container of rabbit food so that on occasion, one of my rabbits get a lucky treat. If the see one of these in their bowl, it is the first thing they eat! I'd say that is the sign of a great product. But remember, these are treats to be given sparingly.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for my squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to feed to the chipmunks and squirrels in my yard. If I keep their feeders full they stay out of my bird feeders. They seem to love them. I put a variety of this brand out for them and they are eating away at them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chaffer

customer_reviews.title: and they are a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have pet rabbits and give these as an occasional treat. Every house rabbit I have loves them. I only give one biscuit to each bunny a few times a week since they are not really a natural food for bunnies. But they sure are a special treat. The bunnies all look forward to them! Always delivered fresh, and they are a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Brock - Love Your Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: My bunnies love these treats
customer_reviews.text: My bunnies love these treats. We give them yogies, the granola bar things, these and a few others but these are by far their favorite. They are now far too familiar with the sound of the bag and now anytime they hear it they stand up and stare at us with their ears back waiting lol. I love that these treats are good for them as well and I don't have to worry about them intaking too much sugars or carbs either these.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa R.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not Right!
customer_reviews.text: I have several rabbits and a chinchilla. NOT one of my animals will eat these, though they did last year! SO something is WRONG with the product! If they do not eat it... they now better than us! I did get refunded with NO questions asked! hmmm
customer_reviews.author: Awen

customer_reviews.title: Tough cookie to crack
customer_reviews.text: I think my gerbils are not big fans? Every time I feed my gerbils these biscuits they kind of just leave them lying around. These biscuits seem to be a last resort of snack for them or as something to shorten their teeth as they are almost as tough as pumice stones. Either way, good source of fiber?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bunnies love these!
customer_reviews.text: My bunnies love these. They’re easy to break in two so that you’re not giving too much sugar to your rabbits. We don’t buy them all the time—Santa Bunny brought these—but as a sometimes treat I know they’re healthy for my buns.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C.

customer_reviews.title: Way to Price Gouge Your Pet Loving Customers!!
customer_reviews.text: **Update** Used to give 5 stars but now they are charging $8 instead of $2! Way to take advantage of your pet loving customers! Review before price gouging - My Piggies love them and they squeak like crazy when I open the bag!!! Do you need any other proof? 😊❤️😊.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: My guinea pigs love them
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I see a lot of people saying their guinea pigs didn't like them and it's only good for rabbits and just wanted to share my experience that both of mine really like them though it took them a couple of days. But since then if I give one of these treats to one, there's a good chance the other will come over to steal it. So your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan L.

customer_reviews.title: My guinea pigs will not eat these
customer_reviews.text: I got two guinea pigs from the Humane Society a few months ago, and I bought 2 bags of these as treats. My guinea pigs won't touch them. I have replaced them in the cage several times - nothing. Not sure why, but I thought I'd mention it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: My chinchillas won't eat them
customer_reviews.text: My chinchillas won't touch these. They aren't very picky, so I was surprised when they wouldn't take these from me. I left them in their bowl and they still didn't eat them. I tried to give them to my chinchillas multiple times. I had to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Serena Reed

customer_reviews.title: My chinchilla loves these
customer_reviews.text: I am very picky what I feed my little guy but wanted to find him some new treat options. These biscuits are way to big to give him all at once so I broke each one up into several pieces and he gets one piece a week. It is a fun and different treat without it being too much that's not good for him.
customer_reviews.author: FreedomLifeSolutions2016

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre and small bag
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs eat this if they feel like there is no other tasty snack coming their way. The price has been decent when they are on sale but it’s too pricey for a small bag of mediocre treats. Definitely not a fan favorite for the piggies.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Most preferred treat!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far our rabbit's favorite treats! They are an excellent value for the amount of product you get (treats should only make up a very small portion of their diet), and our buns get super excited when they see the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: My fur baby (hamster) loves these!
customer_reviews.text: My hamster always eats these treats up very happily! I usually only give her half a cookie as a treat since she's really tiny, so this bag really lasted forever. It's a great treat that's a little "tough" to help with filing down her teeth as well. Love them, and great value!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Truong

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Treat
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these and have this product bookmarked to buy more in the future. My sister's bunny just LOVES these, he gets all excited just from seeing the bag alone. Great product at a wonderful price.
customer_reviews.author: Alexina

customer_reviews.title: Tasty
customer_reviews.text: My bunny was looking a bit off color, and whenever I feel a little queasy I eat food, so I bought 6 bags of these for her. My bunny is a foodie and I thought it best to buy in bulk sense she’s more of a pig than a bunny. When they came I immediately fed my bunny ten and she instantly was back to normal. Food makes everything better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Chinchilla loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this healthy treat for my chinchilla because he is kind of chunky and doesn't need any sugar content in the treats we feed him. He loves these and begs for them every time I am near his cage. The other day he even reached out and grabbed me so I would give him one! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bunny Approved
customer_reviews.text: My three Holland lops will stand up and beg for these treats, and they are not an easily impressed crowd. While these aren't the healthiest option by any means, they are fine to give to your bunny in very limited amounts. I usually give each of my buns one when I get home from work, and then watch them try to scarf their own treat down fast enough to still have time to go steal from each other. It seems to give them enough enjoyment to be well worth the purchase for me- we always keep these on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin W

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my rabbit
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit cannot get enough of these, they are her favorite! Not to mention the price on amazon is way cheaper than at several stores I have looked at. I plan on buying more of these once she runs out, I would totally buy again and suggest people to buy them too.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bartolomei

customer_reviews.title: Made my bunny sick.
customer_reviews.text: My bunny got sick from these. She never has had problems in the past. My vet said it had to have been these.
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: My guinea pig won't eat them (update: unless they're broken up)
customer_reviews.text: Maybe she is especially picky, but my guinea pig will smell and poke at one of these but has yet to take a bite. $1.50 was worth trying a new treat for her, just glad I didn't spend more. UPDATE: I managed to break one of these apart into smaller chunks/crumbs and they disappeared :)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca A

customer_reviews.title: Piggies love this
customer_reviews.text: Our guinea pigs love these treats. When they hear the bag crinkle as it makes noise coming out of the drawer, they start wheeking and chewing on the cage. They can't wait to devour these.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonProShopper

customer_reviews.title: My rabbit’s favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say I’ve sampled the flavor myself, but my rabbit comes racing across the room when he hears this treat bag crinkle. He loves these treats more than any other store bought ones I’ve tried, so I’ll keep buying them for him.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pig approved!
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs love these. They can't get enough of them. I'm not entirely sure why Amazon wants me to rate their flavor. It's not like they're for human consumption. I'm usually not in the habit of eating guinea pig biscuits...
customer_reviews.author: Frequency JonesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: My buns go crazy for these treats!
customer_reviews.text: I barely feed them treats that aren't small pieces of fresh fruits, but here and there I'll treat them to a baked treat. They seem to like Apple and Carrot flavors the most, and goes absolutely crazy for them!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: My bunnies do not care for these
customer_reviews.text: My bunnies aren't very picky, but they won't touch these unless they have been out for a few days. Definitely not something they consider a "treat". The price is fine, but I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Nice treat
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to give my guinea pig so many treats like this and he just doesn't like treats. I'm sure if your piggy likes treats, he will like these. My piggy's favorite is fresh Basil!
customer_reviews.author: Gena R. Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Catnip for bunnies
customer_reviews.text: My Bunny loves these. He is addicted to them. If he hears me opening the bag he will run up to me and run around me in circles until I give him one. It's like cat nip for bunnies.
customer_reviews.author: k craft

customer_reviews.title: Guinea Pigs won't eat them.
customer_reviews.text: Our guinea pigs won't touch these. We don't seem to be alone in this either. At first I thought perhaps it was just our pigs but I am reading others having the same experience as well. At least they didn't cost much as an add on item. We tried them, don't like.
customer_reviews.author: David PAmazonTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: will purchase more
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my sons pet rabbit, he loves them, i am not really sure what he doesn't love but he does get excited when we have treats for him, buying off amazon gives a wider range of options for treats and i don't have to run to all the different feed stores around town to find them. shipping was fast with prime membership
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Addicted
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs LOVE these above any other treat I give them aside from fresh carrots. They love both the apple and carrot flavored ones, they're healthy enough for my piggies to have a few each week, and they are so inexpensive that I usually buy several bags. My gerbils, who can be a bit pickier, really like the apple ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Murray

customer_reviews.title: The girls like them!
customer_reviews.text: The girl piggies like these a lot but the boys are suuuuper picky! I got these for like $2 and beats buying them for like $6 at a pet store!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit with rabbits and hamsters!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased several bags of these, for our pet rabbit, hamster, and to donate to the local animal shelter. Great value, good for the critters since it's made with timothy hay, and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: mossmouse

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Treat Without Sugar
customer_reviews.text: Healthy ingredients are paramount for a healthy pet. I am very careful not to offer my rabbits anything with sugar as it is bad for their digestive system. I use these biscuits as a special treat, reward for good behavior, and as an incentive. The bunnies have free reign during the day, but they come out of hiding or go into their pen eagerly when offered a "cookie." I recommend only one at a time (remember this is equivalent to a doughnut for us humans) and never more than 2 or 3 max per day.
customer_reviews.author: Janice McCollough

customer_reviews.title: Bunny loves loves loves these
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these "cookies" for my bunny several times. She is an indoor bunny, so if I want her to go in the cage, all I have to say is "cookie" and she runs to her cage for one of these. she LOVES them!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not the best (healthiest) ingredients and also they are hard. However these are treats so not fed super often and with a balanced diet I don't mind it for my guinea pigs. They are hard so I soak them in water for a minute or two then give my boys and then they eat them just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Really good treats!
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit loves these, she comes running if she sees the the treats and will eat it the second I take it out of the bag. She prefers these treats over any other treats, if I hold two treats in my hands she always picks these instead of any other treat.
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney M Breen

customer_reviews.title: Good guinea pig treat
customer_reviews.text: Our guinea pig is always excited to see these treats, and the price for the product works for us. We only give treats 1-3 times a week so this bag has lasted us a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My rabbit Love's these!
customer_reviews.text: My Holland Lop bunny loves both the carrot and the apple flavored biscuits! I wouldn't recommend giving a lot of them though if your rabbit is under 4 lb just two a day would be fine. I like that the bag is resealable keeps the biscuits fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Brockmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Our Bunnies Love These!
customer_reviews.text: Our buns love these timothy apple treats. So much, that when I alternate between giving them their oxbow multivitamin they turn their nose away in disappointment it's not this treat. They both recognize the sound of us opening the treat bag and once they hear it -they're standing on their hind legs waiting as cute as can be ;)
customer_reviews.author: Fayelle

customer_reviews.title: Bunny Treats
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a once a week treat. My 2 -6wk old Lionhead bunnies do not seem to like them. They are well priced, texture like a dog biscuit, and seem to be the perfect treat but they won’t eat them n
customer_reviews.author: Kasie Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for rabbits and other small animals!
customer_reviews.text: My rabbit absolutely loves these. They are a must have on hand treat for my rabbit or else I know he would be upset! The first time I gave these to him, I knew they would have to be handy because he scarfed it up in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B

customer_reviews.title: Good chinchilla treat
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the taste but I still give it 5 stars on all. My chinchilla is a little picky but he likes these and looks forward to getting one each time I do.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Peanut was a fan
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the class guinea pig and she was a big fan. We would give her one each day to chew on along with her hay and veggies and she really enjoyed them.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia P.

customer_reviews.title: Winnie Approved!
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard finding treats my cavie likes. Since this product has apples in it I figured she would like it since she like apples! And she does! She is currently munching away! Glad she finally likes something outside of her fresh fruit, veggies and hay diet!
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Bunnies LOVE them!
customer_reviews.text: My Bunny LOVES these, and would definitely buy again! I like that they are just a biscuit, and not covered in sugar. And great buy, when using as a "add-on".
customer_reviews.author: Christina Marshall

customer_reviews.title: DON'T Treat Your Pet to an Early Death!
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 lb nethie bunny ADORES these treats. That said, I was giving him one treat per day, until I suddenly realized that he had gotten very, very, very overweight. This was the only unhealthy part of his diet, which consisted of fresh timothy and orchard grass hay, fresh mixed greens, and limited timothy pellets. I am fighting an uphill battle trying to bring his weight down to a healthy level. Be warned - you can use these to "treat your pet to an early death". Give VERY sparingly, or better yet, NOT AT ALL!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Guinea pigs love it
customer_reviews.text: There hasn't been a treat that my guinea pigs love so much than these. They won't ever refuse to eat one of these and get very excited once they hear the bag crinkle upon opening.
customer_reviews.author: Rankiad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I thought Natures salad by Rosewood was bunny crack- but no, my bunny loved these snacks so much more! Happy to have found another treat that he goes nuts for!
customer_reviews.author: Aly Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Picky pig adores these
customer_reviews.text: My pig just loves these. And she's normally rather picky. But I'll definitely be buying these again. A great snack if they get hungry. But you don't wanna give them anything big!
customer_reviews.author: Connor M

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: My hamster wanted nothing to do with these, and my friend's guinea pigs didn't want them either. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Hen

product_meta.title: Kaytee Timothy Biscuits Baked Treat Apple 4 oz
product_meta.description: Kaytee Timothy Biscuits Baked with Apples are a nutritious treat that provides tooth conditioning and satisfies a small animal’s natural desire to chew. Provides the natural high fiber of timothy grass hay!
feature_bullets: Supports dental health through natural chewing activity
Made with sun cured timothy hay and apples
Great enrichment and foraging for small animals
Ideal for playtime and bonding with your pet rabbit, hamster, chinchilla, and other small pets that crave the taste of real sun cured timothy hay, apples, and molasses
The high fiber content of natural timothy grass hay also supports your pet's overall health

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
